description.english: Store or dispose of sharp objects/medications; use lockboxes or safety caps; ask a trusted person to hold items temporarily. Example: Give razors to a roommate for a week to reduce immediate access.
description.hindi: खुरदरे वस्तुओं/दवाइयों को सुरक्षित रखें या नष्ट कर दें; लॉकबॉक्स या सुरक्षा कैप का उपयोग करें; किसी भरोसेमंद व्यक्ति से अस्थायी रूप से चीजें रखने को कहें। उदाहरण: तत्काल पहुँच कम करने के लिए एक सप्ताह के लिए रेज़र किसी रूममेट को दे दें।
description.marathi: धारदार वस्तू/औषधे सुरक्षित ठिकाणी ठेवा किंवा नष्ट करा; लॉकबॉक्स किंवा सुरक्षा कव्हर वापरा; एखाद्या विश्वासू व्यक्तीला तात्पुरते वस्तू ठेवायला सांगा. उदाहरण: तातडीची उपलब्धता कमी करण्यासाठी रेझर एका आठवड्यासाठी रूममेटला देणे.

description.english: Write warning signs; coping steps; contacts; and emergency numbers; keep it visible. Example: A one-page plan on the phone notes app with 3 grounding steps and a friend's number.
description.hindi: चेतावनी संकेत, मुकाबला कदम, संपर्क और आपातकालीन नंबर लिखकर एक स्पष्ट सुरक्षा योजना बनाएं और इसे जहाँ दिखे रखें। उदाहरण: फोन के नोट्स पर एक पन्ने की योजना जिसमें 3 ग्राउंडिंग कदम और एक दोस्त का नंबर हो।
description.marathi: इशारे, सामना करण्याचे पावले, संपर्क आणि आपत्कालीन नंबर लिहून एक स्पष्ट सुरक्षा योजना तयार करा आणि ती दृश्यमान ठेवा. उदाहरण: फोनच्या नोट्समधील एक पानांची योजना ज्यात 3 ग्राउंडिंग स्टेप्स आणि मित्राचा नंबर असावा.

description.english: Use the 10-minute rule—set a timer and do a neutral activity (shower; tea; walk). Example: Each time the urge hits; fold laundry for 10 minutes; urges often dip in intensity.
description.hindi: 10‑मिनट नियम लागू करें — टाइमर सेट करें और कोई तटस्थ गतिविधि करें (नहाना; चाय; टहलना)। उदाहरण: हर बार जब आवेग आए तो 10 मिनट के लिए कपड़े मोड़ लें; अक्सर आवेग की तीव्रता घट जाती है।
description.marathi: 10‑मिनिट नियम वापरा — टायमर सेट करा आणि एक तटस्थ क्रिया करा (स्नान; चहा; चालणे). उदाहरण: प्रत्येकवेळी आवेग आला की 10 मिनिटांसाठी कपडे मांडणे; अनेकदा आवेगाचा तीव्रपणा कमी होतो.

description.english: 5-4-3-2-1 method: name 5 things you see; 4 feel; 3 hear; 2 smell; 1 taste; pair with slow breathing. Example: In bed at night; label items in the room while exhaling for 6 counts.
description.hindi: 5‑4‑3‑2‑1 तरीका: 5 चीजें जिन्हें आप देखते हैं; 4 जिन्हें आप छूते हैं; 3 जो आप सुनते हैं; 2 जिन्हें आप सूंघते हैं; 1 जो आप चखते हैं; इसे धीमी साँस के साथ जोड़ें। उदाहरण: रात में बिस्तर पर, कमरे की वस्तुओं को नाम देकर बाहर धीरे‑धीरे 6 गिनती तक साँस छोड़ें।
description.marathi: 5‑4‑3‑2‑1 पद्धत: 5 गोष्टी ज्या तुम्ही पाहता; 4 ज्या तुम्ही स्पर्श करता; 3 ज्या तुम्ही ऐकता; 2 ज्या तुम्हाला वास येतो; 1 चव; हे हळूहळू श्वासासोबत करा. उदाहरण: रात्री उशीवर असताना खोलीतील वस्तू नावे घेऊन सहा मोजण्याच्या श्वासासह बाहेर सोडा.

description.english: Swap harmful action with safe sensations (ice cube on wrist; hold a frozen towel; draw on skin with marker). Example: Keep a 'cool kit' in the freezer for high-urge moments.
description.hindi: हानिकारक क्रिया की जगह सुरक्षित संवेदनाएँ अपनाएँ (कलाई पर बर्फ का टुकड़ा; जमे हुए तौलिये को पकड़े; त्वचा पर मार्कर से आरेख बनाना)। उदाहरण: उच्च आवेग के समय के लिए फ्रिज में एक 'कूल किट' रखें।
description.marathi: हानिकारक वर्तनाऐवजी सुरक्षित संवेदनांचा वापर करा (मनावर बर्फाचा तुकडा; गोठवलेले टॉवेल धरून ठेवणे; त्वचेवर मार्करने रेखाटन करणे). उदाहरण: उच्च आवेगाच्या क्षणी 'कूल किट' फ्रिजमध्ये ठेवा.

description.english: Name the emotion + intensity (e.g.; 'sad 7/10') to reduce reactivity; write one need. Example: 'Overwhelmed 8/10—need rest and reassurance.'
description.hindi: भावना और उसकी तीव्रता बताएं (उदा. 'उदास 7/10') ताकि प्रतिक्रियाशीलता कम हो; एक आवश्यकता लिखें। उदाहरण: 'अतिभारित 8/10 — आराम और आश्वासन चाहिए।'
description.marathi: भावना आणि तीव्रता नावाने सांगा (उदा. 'दु:खी 7/10') ज्यामुळे प्रतिक्रियाशीलता कमी होते; एक गरज लिहा. उदाहरण: 'ओव्हरव्हेल्म्ड 8/10 — आराम व आश्वासन हवे.'

description.english: Text/call a trusted person before the urge peaks; use brief scripts. Example: Send 'Having a tough moment—can you stay on the phone 5 mins?'
description.hindi: आवेग उछाल लेने से पहले किसी भरोसेमंद व्यक्ति को टेक्स्ट/कॉल करें; संक्षिप्त स्क्रिप्ट का उपयोग करें। उदाहरण: 'मुझे मुश्किल समय चल रहा है — क्या आप 5 मिनट के लिए फोन पर रहेंगे?'
description.marathi: आवेग peak होण्यापूर्वी विश्वासू व्यक्तीला टेक्स्ट/कॉल करा; छोटे स्क्रिप्ट वापरा. उदाहरण: 'मला कठीण वेळ चालला आहे — 5 मिनिटांसाठी फोनवर राहशील का?'

description.english: Schedule regular therapy; save crisis contacts. Example: Book a weekly CBT/DBT session; add local crisis hotline and nearest ER in favorites.
description.hindi: नियमित थेरेपी शेड्यूल करें; संकट संपर्क सहेजें। उदाहरण: साप्ताहिक CBT/DBT सत्र बुक करें; स्थानीय संकट हॉटलाइन और निकटतम आपातकालीन कक्ष को फेवरेट में जोड़ें।
description.marathi: नियमित थेरपी ठरवा; संकट संपर्क जतन करा. उदाहरण: साप्ताहिक CBT/DBT सत्र बुक करा; स्थानिक संकट हॉटलाइन व जवळच्या ER चे नंबर जतन करा.

description.english: Keep consistent sleep/wake times; plan simple meals and movement. Example: 11 pm lights out; 7 am wake; 20-minute walk after lunch; prep snacks on Sundays.
description.hindi: नियमित सोने‑जागने के समय रखें; सरल भोजन और हल्की गतिविधि की योजना बनाएं। उदाहरण: रात 11 बजे लाइट बंद; सुबह 7 बजे उठना; दोपहर के बाद 20‑मिनट की सैर; रविवार को स्नैक्स तैयार रखें।
description.marathi: सुसंगत झोप/उठण्याच्या वेळा ठेवा; साधी भोजन व हलकी हालचाल नियोजित करा. उदाहरण: रात्री 11 वाजता दिवे बंद; सकाळी 7 वाजता उठा; जेवणानंतर 20 मिनिट चालणे; रविवारी स्नॅक्स तयार ठेवा.

description.english: Why it helps: Identifies patterns that precede urges for targeted interventions. What to do: Track time; place; people; emotion (0–10); and urge (0–10) after each spike. Example: 10:30 pm; alone in room; sadness 7/10; urge 6/10 after argument.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Identifies patterns that precede urges for targeted interventions. What to do: Track time; place; people; emotion (0–10); and urge (0–10) after each spike. Example: 10:30 pm; alone in room; sadness 7/10; urge 6/10 after argument.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Identifies patterns that precede urges for targeted interventions. What to do: Track time; place; people; emotion (0–10); and urge (0–10) after each spike. Example: 10:30 pm; alone in room; sadness 7/10; urge 6/10 after argument.""

description.english: Why it helps: Brings hidden thoughts to light to challenge them. What to do: Write situation; automatic thought; emotion; behavior urge. Example: Situation: criticism; Thought: """"I’m useless""""; Emotion: shame 8/10; Urge: cut 7/10.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Brings hidden thoughts to light to challenge them. What to do: Write situation; automatic thought; emotion; behavior urge. Example: Situation: criticism; Thought: """"I’m useless""""; Emotion: shame 8/10; Urge: cut 7/10.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Brings hidden thoughts to light to challenge them. What to do: Write situation; automatic thought; emotion; behavior urge. Example: Situation: criticism; Thought: """"I’m useless""""; Emotion: shame 8/10; Urge: cut 7/10.""

description.english: Why it helps: Replaces distorted thoughts with balanced alternatives. What to do: Test thought for evidence; alternatives; and realistic outcome. Example: """"I can’t cope"""" → """"I’ve coped before using ice + call—try again.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Replaces distorted thoughts with balanced alternatives. What to do: Test thought for evidence; alternatives; and realistic outcome. Example: """"I can’t cope"""" → """"I’ve coped before using ice + call—try again.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Replaces distorted thoughts with balanced alternatives. What to do: Test thought for evidence; alternatives; and realistic outcome. Example: """"I can’t cope"""" → """"I’ve coped before using ice + call—try again.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Counters withdrawal that worsens mood and urges. What to do: Schedule 3 daily activities: one pleasure; one mastery; one connection. Example: Walk 15 min; finish email; text a friend.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Counters withdrawal that worsens mood and urges. What to do: Schedule 3 daily activities: one pleasure; one mastery; one connection. Example: Walk 15 min; finish email; text a friend.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Counters withdrawal that worsens mood and urges. What to do: Schedule 3 daily activities: one pleasure; one mastery; one connection. Example: Walk 15 min; finish email; text a friend.""

description.english: Why it helps: Offers rapid; safe replacements during peak urges. What to do: Prepare kit: ice pack; sour candy; grounding card; music. Example: Hold ice to wrist 60s + 5-4-3-2-1 until urge drops below 4/10.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Offers rapid; safe replacements during peak urges. What to do: Prepare kit: ice pack; sour candy; grounding card; music. Example: Hold ice to wrist 60s + 5-4-3-2-1 until urge drops below 4/10.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Offers rapid; safe replacements during peak urges. What to do: Prepare kit: ice pack; sour candy; grounding card; music. Example: Hold ice to wrist 60s + 5-4-3-2-1 until urge drops below 4/10.""

description.english: Why it helps: Shifts from ruminating to concrete plans. What to do: Define problem; brainstorm 3 options; pick one; plan next step. Example: Issue: roommate conflict → Option: set meeting and script requests.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Shifts from ruminating to concrete plans. What to do: Define problem; brainstorm 3 options; pick one; plan next step. Example: Issue: roommate conflict → Option: set meeting and script requests.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Shifts from ruminating to concrete plans. What to do: Define problem; brainstorm 3 options; pick one; plan next step. Example: Issue: roommate conflict → Option: set meeting and script requests.""

description.english: Why it helps: Teaches that urges rise/fall like waves without acting. What to do: Set 10-minute timer; observe sensations; breathe 4-in/6-out; rate urge each minute. Example: 7→6→4 by minute 10.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Teaches that urges rise/fall like waves without acting. What to do: Set 10-minute timer; observe sensations; breathe 4-in/6-out; rate urge each minute. Example: 7→6→4 by minute 10.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Teaches that urges rise/fall like waves without acting. What to do: Set 10-minute timer; observe sensations; breathe 4-in/6-out; rate urge each minute. Example: 7→6→4 by minute 10.""

description.english: Why it helps: Reduces immediate risk when urges peak. What to do: List warning signs; coping steps; contacts; lock up or hand off sharp objects/meds. Example: Friend holds razors; crisis numbers pinned.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Reduces immediate risk when urges peak. What to do: List warning signs; coping steps; contacts; lock up or hand off sharp objects/meds. Example: Friend holds razors; crisis numbers pinned.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Reduces immediate risk when urges peak. What to do: List warning signs; coping steps; contacts; lock up or hand off sharp objects/meds. Example: Friend holds razors; crisis numbers pinned.""

description.english: Why it helps: Lowers shame that fuels the cycle. What to do: Write 3 statements to read aloud in crises. Example: """"This urge will pass. I can choose safety. I deserve care even when I’m hurting.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Lowers shame that fuels the cycle. What to do: Write 3 statements to read aloud in crises. Example: """"This urge will pass. I can choose safety. I deserve care even when I’m hurting.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Lowers shame that fuels the cycle. What to do: Write 3 statements to read aloud in crises. Example: """"This urge will pass. I can choose safety. I deserve care even when I’m hurting.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Clarifies what triggers urges so you can intervene earlier. What to do: List recent situations; thoughts; sensations before urges. Example: Argument with partner + sleepless night → urge rose to 7/10.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Clarifies what triggers urges so you can intervene earlier. What to do: List recent situations; thoughts; sensations before urges. Example: Argument with partner + sleepless night → urge rose to 7/10.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Clarifies what triggers urges so you can intervene earlier. What to do: List recent situations; thoughts; sensations before urges. Example: Argument with partner + sleepless night → urge rose to 7/10.""

description.english: Why it helps: REBT targets rigid; extreme; and illogical beliefs that fuel urges. What to do: Write down beliefs starting with must/should/always/never. Example: """"I must never feel weak; if I do; I deserve pain.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: REBT targets rigid; extreme; and illogical beliefs that fuel urges. What to do: Write down beliefs starting with must/should/always/never. Example: """"I must never feel weak; if I do; I deserve pain.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: REBT targets rigid; extreme; and illogical beliefs that fuel urges. What to do: Write down beliefs starting with must/should/always/never. Example: """"I must never feel weak; if I do; I deserve pain.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Logical; empirical; and pragmatic disputes weaken urges. What to do: Ask 3 questions—Is it true? Where’s the proof? Is this belief helpful? Example: """"I can’t handle this"""" → Evidence: handled last week with grounding + call.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Logical; empirical; and pragmatic disputes weaken urges. What to do: Ask 3 questions—Is it true? Where’s the proof? Is this belief helpful? Example: """"I can’t handle this"""" → Evidence: handled last week with grounding + call.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Logical; empirical; and pragmatic disputes weaken urges. What to do: Ask 3 questions—Is it true? Where’s the proof? Is this belief helpful? Example: """"I can’t handle this"""" → Evidence: handled last week with grounding + call.""

description.english: Why it helps: Balanced beliefs reduce intensity and open safer choices. What to do: Replace demands with preferences and toleration. Example: """"I prefer to feel in control; but I can stand discomfort and seek support.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Balanced beliefs reduce intensity and open safer choices. What to do: Replace demands with preferences and toleration. Example: """"I prefer to feel in control; but I can stand discomfort and seek support.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Balanced beliefs reduce intensity and open safer choices. What to do: Replace demands with preferences and toleration. Example: """"I prefer to feel in control; but I can stand discomfort and seek support.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Cuts shame that drives self-punishment. What to do: Separate worth from performance and emotions. Example: """"I did a thing I dislike; but I’m not a worthless person.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Cuts shame that drives self-punishment. What to do: Separate worth from performance and emotions. Example: """"I did a thing I dislike; but I’m not a worthless person.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Cuts shame that drives self-punishment. What to do: Separate worth from performance and emotions. Example: """"I did a thing I dislike; but I’m not a worthless person.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Builds tolerance for distress spikes that precede urges. What to do: Practice statements: """"It’s hard; not unbearable; I can stand it."""" Example: Ride a 10-minute urge wave using paced breathing.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Builds tolerance for distress spikes that precede urges. What to do: Practice statements: """"It’s hard; not unbearable; I can stand it."""" Example: Ride a 10-minute urge wave using paced breathing.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Builds tolerance for distress spikes that precede urges. What to do: Practice statements: """"It’s hard; not unbearable; I can stand it."""" Example: Ride a 10-minute urge wave using paced breathing.""

description.english: Why it helps: Softens rigid musts that escalate crises. What to do: Convert must/should to prefer/want and add flexibility. Example: """"I want relief now; but I don’t need it immediately; I can use my plan.""""""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Softens rigid musts that escalate crises. What to do: Convert must/should to prefer/want and add flexibility. Example: """"I want relief now; but I don’t need it immediately; I can use my plan.""""""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Softens rigid musts that escalate crises. What to do: Convert must/should to prefer/want and add flexibility. Example: """"I want relief now; but I don’t need it immediately; I can use my plan.""""""

description.english: Why it helps: Highlights pragmatic costs/benefits to counter tunnel vision. What to do: Make a 2-column list: short-term relief vs long-term harm/alternatives. Example: Relief 5 min vs wounds; shame; hiding; alternative: call + ice.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Highlights pragmatic costs/benefits to counter tunnel vision. What to do: Make a 2-column list: short-term relief vs long-term harm/alternatives. Example: Relief 5 min vs wounds; shame; hiding; alternative: call + ice.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Highlights pragmatic costs/benefits to counter tunnel vision. What to do: Make a 2-column list: short-term relief vs long-term harm/alternatives. Example: Relief 5 min vs wounds; shame; hiding; alternative: call + ice.""

description.english: Why it helps: Repetition builds insight and faster disputing. What to do: Daily log A (event); B (belief); C (feeling/urge 0–10); D (dispute); E (new effect). Example: A: loneliness; B: """"no one cares""""; C: 8; D: evidence check; E: 4.""
description.hindi: Why it helps: Repetition builds insight and faster disputing. What to do: Daily log A (event); B (belief); C (feeling/urge 0–10); D (dispute); E (new effect). Example: A: loneliness; B: """"no one cares""""; C: 8; D: evidence check; E: 4.""
description.marathi: Why it helps: Repetition builds insight and faster disputing. What to do: Daily log A (event); B (belief); C (feeling/urge 0–10); D (dispute); E (new effect). Example: A: loneliness; B: """"no one cares""""; C: 8; D: evidence check; E: 4.""
